Package info.ryandorman.simplescheduler.common

Class TimeSpinner

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.control.Control
            • javafx.scene.control.Spinner<java.time.LocalTime>
              • info.ryandorman.simplescheduler.common.TimeSpinner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.scene.control.Skinnable
    public class TimeSpinner
extends javafx.scene.control.Spinner<java.time.LocalTime>
    Extends javafx.scene.control.Spinner to handle time input. Design inspired by How to make a TimeSpinner in JavaFx.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TimeSpinner()
      Creates a new class instance that sets the default input value to the current time.
      TimeSpinner​(java.lang.String format, java.time.LocalTime defaultValue)
      Creates a new class instance that sets the default input value and time format to the defined parameters.
      TimeSpinner​(java.time.LocalTime defaultValue)
      Creates a new class instance that sets the default input value to the user defined time parameter.

        private static final java.lang.String format
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeSpinner

        public TimeSpinner()
        Creates a new class instance that sets the default input value to the current time. Allows auto-instantiation through *.fxml files.

      • TimeSpinner

        public TimeSpinner​(java.time.LocalTime defaultValue)
        Creates a new class instance that sets the default input value to the user defined time parameter.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - Default input value (e.g., time) to display.

      • TimeSpinner

        public TimeSpinner​(java.lang.String format,
                   java.time.LocalTime defaultValue)
        Creates a new class instance that sets the default input value and time format to the defined parameters.
        Parameters:
        format - Time format pattern appropriate for java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter
        defaultValue - Default input value (e.g., time) to display.

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultValue

        public void setDefaultValue​(java.time.LocalTime defaultValue)
        Sets the default input value to the user defined time parameter.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - Default input value (e.g., time) to display.

      • getSpinnerLocalTimeFactory

        private javafx.scene.control.SpinnerValueFactory<java.time.LocalTime> getSpinnerLocalTimeFactory​(java.lang.String format)
        Gets a javafx.scene.control.SpinnerValueFactory that allows java.time.LocalTime input.
        Parameters:
        format - String representing the format to display the time input
        Returns:
        factory to be used as TimeSpinner's value factory

      • getLocalTimeFormatter

        private javafx.scene.control.TextFormatter<java.time.LocalTime> getLocalTimeFormatter​(java.time.LocalTime defaultValue)
        Gets a javafx.scene.control.TextFormatter that can parse LocalTime to and from user's text input.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - The java.time.LocalTime value to return if an invalid string format is encountered
        Returns:
        Formatter to manage the string formatting of time input into the TimeSpinner

      • getTimeSpinnerSelectionRules

        private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> getTimeSpinnerSelectionRules()
        Get javafx.event.EventHandler that allows for easy selection of hour and minute input displayed in the TimeSpinner. A Lambda is used to simplify formatting and quickly return the javafx.event.EventHandler needed to create the correct selection behavior.
        Returns:
        EventHandler that configures the TimeSpinner's input selection
